column2: AS BEST I COULD TELL FROM MY READING, JOHN QUINCY ADAMS WAS AN ADMIRED POLITICIAN BOTH BEFORE AND AFTER HIS TERM, BUT WHILE PRESIDENT THERE WERE OBJECTIONS TO SOME OF HIS DOMESTIC PROPOSALS AND NOTHING OF MUCH CONSEQUENCE OCCURRED IN FOREIGN AFFAIRS.
